conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volumes read as spaces, and the camera is in an elevated angled/isometric-like view with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D wall solids with readable corners and room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplification of some edges/openings and uniform wall treatment slightly reduces realism/precision.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and core adjacency (central living/dining, kitchen/utility zone, three bedrooms, office/maid room, clustered toilets) largely matches. Some exterior/deck/balcony extents and a few internal partition lengths/opening placements appear approximated rather than dimension-faithful.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, sofa set, dining, kitchen cabinetry, office desk) and generally placed in correct rooms at reasonable scale; bathroom fixtures are simplified but present.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with clear separation of walls/floors/openings; lighting is adequate. Some window/opening definition is soft and exterior spaces are less clearly articulated.

detected_errors.description: Balcony/deck geometry appears simplified; at least one exterior terrace/balcony extent does not clearly match the 2D plan’s long deck and right-side balcony proportions.
Some doors/windows are not clearly positioned or sized to match the 2D plan exactly (openings appear approximated or omitted in places).
Openings and facade/window detailing are understated, reducing verification confidence for exact window placement.

summary: A valid and clean 3D cutaway with largely faithful room layout and furnishings, but with some approximations in balcony/deck geometry and certain openings.
